definition: straight/to straighten/fair and reasonable/frank/straightforward/(indicates continuing motion or action)/vertical/vertical downward stroke in Chinese characters
surname Zhi/Zhi (c. 2000 BC), fifth of the legendary Flame Emperors 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God

sentences.english: INTRODUCTION People often discuss literal translation and free translation.
sentences.chinese: 引言人們經常討論直譯和意譯。

sentences.english: Has your support, the journey is not far away.
sentences.chinese: 有你的支持，直譯的路程不在遙遠。

sentences.english: Foreignizing translation goes beyond literalism and encourages experiments and innovations.
sentences.chinese: 異化超越直譯，提倡翻譯實驗與創新。

sentences.english: Don't judge a book by its ver.
sentences.chinese: 諺語，直譯“不要根據書皮來判斷書的內容”。

sentences.english: People often discuss literal translation and free translation.
sentences.chinese: 引言人們經常討論直譯和意譯。

sentences.english: The Management Committee of the People's Commune of Chengguan Town, XX County.
sentences.chinese: “城關”是一個縣城的關口的意思，直譯即可。

sentences.english: Choose a wife on a Saturday rather than a Sunday.
sentences.chinese: 如果把它直譯爲“擇妻宜在星期六，不宜在星期日”。

sentences.english: Therefore, Europeanization is closely related with literal translation.
sentences.chinese: 而直譯與“歐化”正相輔相成。

sentences.english: People who favor literal translation think that it helps to keep alienness and enrich Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 贊成直譯的人認爲直譯可以保留洋味並能豐富漢語。

sentences.english: People who favor literal translation think that it helps to keep alienness and enrich Chinese.
sentences.chinese: 贊成直譯的人認爲直譯可以保留洋味並能豐富漢語。

sentences.english: Intermediate forms such as the output of a preprocessor or translator are not allowed.
sentences.chinese: 中間形式，如直譯器或翻譯器的輸出，都是不允許的。

sentences.english: But it turns out he is an advocate of biblical literalism.
sentences.chinese: 但結果他其實提倡聖經直譯主義。

sentences.english: It has become quite popular, as it is more readable than other literal translations.
sentences.chinese: 它已成爲頗爲流行，因爲它比其他直譯譯本更可讀。

definition: radical of a compound word (in European language)
to write characters in simplified form/the simplified form of a character/to abbreviate (a word or expression)/to write in simple language
to write a word incorrectly/typo/(medicine) to mistakenly transplant (an infected organ etc)
